page.title: 06Well Vale Farms
page.content: Well Vale Farms are owned by an American and are run on a day to day basis by a manager with 7 other people employed on the farms. The farms consist of 1252 acres of farming land and 400 acres of woodland. Although there are 160 breeding sheep, on permanent pasture land, the farm is mainly arable with wheat, barley, oilseed rape and peas grown. The land is reasonably fertile and relies on a very mechanised farming practice, including the use of 5 tractors and a combine harvester. The use of more technology in farming has meant that many of the farm labourers' cottages now stand idle or are used as holiday accommodation.
